remarks: An expression equinumerous to 2 to an aleph power.  The proof equates the two laws for cardinal exponentiation ~ alephexp1 (which works if the base is less than or equal to the exponent) and ~ infmap (which works if the exponent is less than or equal to the base).  They can be equated only when the base is equal to the exponent, and this is the result. (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2004.)
statement:
alephexp2 $p |- ( A e. On -> ( 2o ^m ( aleph ` A ) ) ~~ { x | ( x C_ ( aleph ` A ) /\ x ~~ ( aleph ` A ) ) } ) $.
$d A x $.
